page.title: 15The Street Where I Live
page.content: The houses are all lined up in groups of four. At the back is a yard. Not all the houses have gardens. Most of the houses now have extensions, as in the old days they had to share a toilet in the yard. There are about 50 houses in Pitt Street, 1 church and 2 pubs. Across from the pit is a farm, which has 2 fields, in which they keep cows. There are paths leading to the allotments. The houses are about 100 years old. The houses have two bedrooms, a front room, dining room, kitchen and bathroom. The rooms are big and high, and are heated by a coal fire. When the fire has been alight for a few hours the walls all begin to get hot. I was born in this house, before that my family lived in Wombwell.
